column1: A sialogram is an x-ray of the salivary ducts and glands.
The test is performed in a hospital radiology department or a radiology facility.
A catheter (a small flexible tube) is inserted through your mouth and into the duct of the salivary gland.
The x-rays are then repeated to examine the drainage of the saliva into the mouth.
A sialogram may be done when your provider thinks you might have a disorder of the salivary ducts or glands.
